Jon:
Sorry I posted an unusable link, here is the link to some notes on 
us=
ing the document function of XSL for REST.

http://twiki.org/cgi-bin/view/C=
odev/XslWiki 

When you attempt to access 
http://twiki.org/cgi-bin/view/Co=
dev/ThisPageDoesNotExist , you  get 
the "This Wiki topic does not exist ye=
t ". if xsl document function 
attempted get the non-existing page from the=
 CGI, a CGI could detect 
content unique to the recovery page (like the Thi=
s Wiki topic does 
not exist yet screen) that it can process in most cases =
The TWiki 
CGI can catch the error. 

A CGI can catching the 401 error, and=
 provide a page that can be 
processed. This was my real point. 

At least =
in the MSIE xsl client case, when you do get an 401 error, 
it produces a X=
HTML compatable error that can be processed also.
John.
